page.title: 16Emergency Services,Whitby 2.
page.content: The{lifeboat crew}consist of 3 inshore and 5 off-shore men, although a total of 18 men form the lifeboat pool.Emergency calls are answered via the{Coastguard.}The lifeboat can be launched in two and a half minutes.A lifeboatman wears boots, orange bib and brace waterproof trousers, jacket, life jacket and safety helmet.On average about 24 calls per year are answered. The Coastguard keeps constant watch every day between 8.00a.m. and 7.00p.m.Every half hour for three minutes there is a silent period on the radio to enable the tracking of possible distress calls.An RAF helicopter from Leconfield can be called upon for rescue work.It takes about 30 minutes to arrive on the scene.
